pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.10_0: Then those nuns went to the Buddha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.10_1: They approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.10_2: Those nuns then said to the Buddha, “Nuns, I hope the instruction was effective?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.11_0: “Venerable Sir, how could the instruction be effective?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.12_0: After giving just a short teaching, the monks from the group of six spent the day on pointless talk, and then dismissed us.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.13_0: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened those nuns with a teaching.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.14_0: After the Buddha had instructed, inspired, and gladdened those nuns with a teaching, they bowed down, circumambulated him with their right side toward him, and left.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.15_0: The Buddha convened the Sangha of monks and questioned those monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.16_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.19_0: “Foolish men, how can you give just a short teaching to the nuns, and then spend the day on pointless talk, before dismissing them?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.25_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.26_0: “Monks, you should appoint a monk who possesses eight qualities as an instructor of the nuns:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.27_0: One who is virtuous and restrained by the Monastic Code. His conduct is good, he associates with the right people, and he sees danger in minor faults. He undertakes and trains in the training rules.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.28_0: He has learned much, and he retains and accumulates what he has learned. Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, that have a true goal and are well articulated, and that set out the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life—he has learned many such teachings, retained them in mind, recited them verbally, mentally investigated them, and penetrated them well by view.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.29_0: He has properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail; he has well analyzed them, thoroughly mastered them, and well investigated them, both in terms of the rules and their detailed exposition.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.30_0: They’re a good speaker and speak well.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.31_0: He is generally liked by and pleasing to the nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.32_0: He is capable of instructing the nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.33_0: He has never committed a heavy offense against a Buddhist nun.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.34_0: He has been fully ordained for at least twenty years.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.35_0: Monks, you should appoint a monk who possesses these eight qualities as an instructor of the nuns.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.4_0: “Well then, let’s go outside the monastic boundary, appoint each other as instructors of the nuns, and then instruct them.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.5_0: After doing just that, they again went to the nuns and said, “Sisters, we too have been appointed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.6_0: Come to us, and we too will instruct you.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.12_0: If he instructs a nun who is fully ordained only on one side, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.13_0: The monk who has been agreed upon should sweep the precincts, set out water for drinking and water for washing, prepare a seat, get hold of a companion, and then sit down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.14_0: The nuns should go there, bow down to the monk, and sit down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.15_0: The monk should then ask them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.17_0: If they say, “We’re all present, Venerable,” he should say, “Are you keeping the eight important principles?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.18_0: If they say, “We’re there, Venerable,” he should hand the instruction to you,”:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.19_0: If they say, “We’re not,” he should recite the important principles:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.20_0: A nun who has been given the full ordination on which she perceives her as such, and she bows down to him, rise up for him, raise her joined palms to him, and do acts of respect toward him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.21_0: This rule too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.22_0: A nun should not spend the rainy season in a monastery without monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.23_0: This rule too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.32_0: A trainee nun who has trained in the six rules for two years may seek for full ordination in both Sanghas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.34_0: A nun may not in any way abuse or revile a monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.36_0: From today onwards, nuns may not correct monks, but monks may correct nuns.
